In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's an example of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_string)
    line_length = 0
    wrapped_string = ""

    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_string *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        end
        wrapped_string *= "$word "
        line_length += length(word) + 1
    end

    return wrapped_string
end

# Example usage
input_string = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
wrapped_output = wrap_string(input_string, 20)
println(wrapped_output)
```

This code defines the `wrap_string` function that wraps a string based on the specified `text_width`. The function splits the input string into words and adds a newline whenever the maximum text width is exceeded. You can adjust the `text_width` parameter to see how it affects the output.
